20110129020012.000|20110129020015.000|TR0|East in turmoil.
20110129020015.000|20110129020018.000|TR0|

20110129020021.000|20110129020024.000|TR0|power of the Internet sweeping across the

20110129020026.000|20110129020029.000|TR0|the fury spreading to Egypt, the nation 
20110129020029.000|20110129020032.000|TR0|some say is the key to peace in the Middle 
20110129020032.000|20110129020035.000|TR0|East is on the verge of total chaos.  
20110129020035.000|20110129020038.000|TR0|President Hosni Mubarak has dissolved the 
20110129020038.000|20110129020041.000|TR0|government.  Protesters are tonight 
20110129020041.000|20110129020043.000|TR0|swarming the streets, Cairo, Alexandria 
20110129020043.000|20110129020046.000|TR0|and Suez.

20110129020206.000|20110129020209.000|TR0|turmoil and tension around the world.  
20110129020209.000|20110129020212.000|TR0|We're covering this across Egypt from

20110129020257.000|20110129020300.000|TR0|demonstrators who were attacking and 
20110129020300.000|20110129020303.000|TR0|fighting with the police throughout the 
20110129020303.000|20110129020306.000|TR0|day -- in fact, throughout the last four 
20110129020306.000|20110129020308.000|TR0|days -- suddenly cheered the arrival of 
20110129020308.000|20110129020311.000|TR0|the army.
20110129020311.000|20110129020314.000|TR0|

20110129020317.000|20110129020320.000|TR0|disappeared.  There's a police station 
20110129020320.000|20110129020323.000|TR0|just behind our office which he saw the 
20110129020323.000|20110129020325.000|TR0|crowd of protesters going after, 
20110129020325.000|20110129020328.000|TR0|attacking, trying to break down the metal 
20110129020328.000|20110129020331.000|TR0|doors.  The policemen were inside huddled. 
20110129020331.000|20110129020334.000|TR0| They tried to defend themselves with tear 
20110129020334.000|20110129020337.000|TR0|gas, but quickly changed into civilian 
20110129020337.000|20110129020340.000|TR0|clothing and simply ran away.
20110129020340.000|20110129020342.000|TR0|

20110129020431.000|20110129020434.000|TR0|we'll see.  We'll see if the army is 
20110129020434.000|20110129020436.000|TR0|willing to defend the president of the 
20110129020436.000|20110129020439.000|TR0|government or it will simply stand by and 
20110129020439.000|20110129020442.000|TR0|let the people demonstrate, which the 
20110129020442.000|20110129020445.000|TR0|demonstration started on Tuesday quite 
20110129020445.000|20110129020448.000|TR0|peacefully.  Of course, as the state used 
20110129020448.000|20110129020451.000|TR0|more and more violence against them, they 
20110129020451.000|20110129020454.000|TR0|started to use violence against the police.
20110129020454.000|20110129020456.000|TR0|
20110129020456.000|20110129020459.000|TR0|The police widely resented for being 
20110129020459.000|20110129020502.000|TR0|corrupt, for using torture, for detaining 
20110129020502.000|20110129020505.000|TR0|people, for no reason whatsoever.  The 
20110129020505.000|20110129020508.000|TR0|army -- what we've seen so far is they 
20110129020508.000|20110129020511.000|TR0|have not tried to stop people from 
20110129020511.000|20110129020513.000|TR0|protesting.  It seems that their job at 
20110129020513.000|20110129020516.000|TR0|the moment is simply to be deployed 
20110129020516.000|20110129020519.000|TR0|outside government buildings and prevent 
20110129020519.000|20110129020522.000|TR0|them from being ransacked.  It hasn't 
20110129020522.000|20110129020525.000|TR0|always worked.
20110129020525.000|20110129020528.000|TR0|
20110129020528.000|20110129020530.000|TR0|Just down the street from here, the ruling 
20110129020530.000|20110129020533.000|TR0|National Democratic Party headquarters, a 
20110129020533.000|20110129020536.000|TR0|few hours ago, it was utterly in flames.

20110129020539.000|20110129020542.000|TR0|inside but that, of course, was a symbol

20110129020545.000|20110129020548.000|TR0|President Hosni Mubarak.  So, that gives 
20110129020548.000|20110129020550.000|TR0|you an indication of the sentiment people 
20110129020550.000|20110129020553.000|TR0|have toward the president who has been in 
20110129020553.000|20110129020556.000|TR0|power since 1981.

20110129020610.000|20110129020613.000|TR0|this protest is really about?
20110129020613.000|20110129020616.000|TR0|
20110129020616.000|20110129020619.000|TR0|NIC ROBERTSON, CNN SR. INTERNATIONAL 
20110129020619.000|20110129020622.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  People want change.  They 
20110129020622.000|20110129020624.000|TR0|want a better life.  They don't feel that 
20110129020624.000|20110129020627.000|TR0|they can feed their families in the way 
20110129020627.000|20110129020630.000|TR0|that they used to.  They want -- they have 
20110129020630.000|20110129020633.000|TR0|aspirations for their children.
20110129020633.000|20110129020636.000|TR0|
20110129020636.000|20110129020639.000|TR0|I talked to a man this evening, a 
20110129020639.000|20110129020642.000|TR0|middle-aged man.  His daughter was 10 
20110129020642.000|20110129020644.000|TR0|years old, and went out to the streets to 
20110129020644.000|20110129020647.000|TR0|see the army armored personnel carrier on 
20110129020647.000|20110129020650.000|TR0|the center of the city here.  And he said 
20110129020650.000|20110129020653.000|TR0|he just wants her to have a better life 
20110129020653.000|20110129020656.000|TR0|than the one he's having and to have a 
20110129020656.000|20110129020659.000|TR0|good education.     And that's one of the 
20110129020659.000|20110129020701.000|TR0|things people here don't get.  It's really 
20110129020701.000|20110129020704.000|TR0|simple.  They want a better life, and the 
20110129020704.000|20110129020707.000|TR0|guy in charge for the last 30 years hasn't 
20110129020707.000|20110129020710.000|TR0|given it to them.
20110129020710.000|20110129020713.000|TR0|
20110129020713.000|20110129020716.000|TR0|So, when they hear him on TV saying, "Hey, 
20110129020716.000|20110129020718.000|TR0|I understand you," "Hey, I'm going to make 
20110129020718.000|20110129020721.000|TR0|it better," they know.  They know that 
20110129020721.000|20110129020724.000|TR0|that's not going to happen.  And that's 
20110129020724.000|20110129020727.000|TR0|what's going to make them and is making 
20110129020727.000|20110129020730.000|TR0|them even more angry right now -- Piers.

20110129021026.000|20110129021029.000|TR0|translator):  I ask the government to 
20110129021029.000|20110129021032.000|TR0|resign today.  And I will tell the new 
20110129021032.000|20110129021035.000|TR0|government from tomorrow in very specific 
20110129021035.000|20110129021037.000|TR0|goals to work with the current situation.  
20110129021037.000|20110129021040.000|TR0|I will say again, I will not be easy to 
20110129021040.000|20110129021043.000|TR0|take any -- to decide anything unless it's 
20110129021043.000|20110129021046.000|TR0|for the Egyptians.
20110129021046.000|20110129021049.000|TR0|
20110129021049.000|20110129021052.000|TR0|OBAMA:  When President Mubarak addressed 
20110129021052.000|20110129021054.000|TR0|the Egyptian people tonight, he pledged a 
20110129021054.000|20110129021057.000|TR0|better democracy and greater economic 
20110129021057.000|20110129021100.000|TR0|opportunity.  I just spoke to him after 
20110129021100.000|20110129021103.000|TR0|his speech and I told him he has a 
20110129021103.000|20110129021106.000|TR0|responsibility to give meaning to those 
20110129021106.000|20110129021109.000|TR0|words, to take concrete steps and actions 
20110129021109.000|20110129021112.000|TR0|that deliver on that promise.  Violence 
20110129021112.000|20110129021114.000|TR0|will not address the grievances of the 
20110129021114.000|20110129021117.000|TR0|Egyptian people.
20110129021117.000|20110129021120.000|TR0|
20110129021120.000|20110129021123.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIPS)
20110129021123.000|20110129021126.000|TR0|
20110129021126.000|20110129021129.000|TR0|MORGAN:  Wolf, if I could start with you, 
20110129021129.000|20110129021131.000|TR0|what's fascinating about this whole 
20110129021131.000|20110129021134.000|TR0|uprising is it's not the conventional 
20110129021134.000|20110129021137.000|TR0|anti-American sentiment or being fanned at 
20110129021137.000|20110129021140.000|TR0|the start certainly by any sort of Islamic 
20110129021140.000|20110129021143.000|TR0|fundamentalism.  And what is emerging 
20110129021143.000|20110129021146.000|TR0|tonight is disappointment, it seems, that 
20110129021146.000|20110129021148.000|TR0|President Obama not going far enough. And 
20110129021148.000|20110129021151.000|TR0|one of the reasons, of course, may be that 
20110129021151.000|20110129021154.000|TR0|the Americans have always supported 
20110129021154.000|20110129021157.000|TR0|President Mubarak in the past.  So, there 
20110129021157.000|20110129021200.000|TR0|is an allegation that they've gone easy on 
20110129021200.000|20110129021203.000|TR0|him because it's been embarrassing.
20110129021203.000|20110129021206.000|TR0|
20110129021206.000|20110129021208.000|TR0|WOLF BLITZER, HOST, "THE SITUATION ROOM":  
20110129021208.000|20110129021211.000|TR0|There's been a 30-year relationship, a 
20110129021211.000|20110129021214.000|TR0|positive relationship, between the U.S. 
20110129021214.000|20110129021217.000|TR0|and Egypt going back to Anwar Sadat and 
20110129021217.000|20110129021220.000|TR0|then 1981 to Hosni Mubarak.  And that 
20110129021220.000|20110129021223.000|TR0|relationship has been incredibly close on 
20110129021223.000|20110129021225.000|TR0|the economic, military, political, 
20110129021225.000|20110129021228.000|TR0|intelligence, all of the levels.
20110129021228.000|20110129021231.000|TR0|
20110129021231.000|20110129021234.000|TR0|The U.S. military and the Egyptian 
20110129021234.000|20110129021237.000|TR0|military work very closely together.  Over 
20110129021237.000|20110129021240.000|TR0|all of these years, Piers, the United 
20110129021240.000|20110129021242.000|TR0|States has provided tens of billions of 
20110129021242.000|20110129021245.000|TR0|dollars in foreign aid, economic and 
20110129021245.000|20110129021248.000|TR0|military assistance, to Egypt -- the best 
20110129021248.000|20110129021251.000|TR0|U.S. military equipment, F- 16 fighter 
20110129021251.000|20110129021254.000|TR0|jets.  The Egyptian military has a 
20110129021254.000|20110129021257.000|TR0|powerful -- a powerful capability.
20110129021257.000|20110129021300.000|TR0|
20110129021300.000|20110129021302.000|TR0|And the question that U.S. officials are 
20110129021302.000|20110129021305.000|TR0|wondering, they don't have any hard

20110129023848.000|20110129023851.000|TR0|Mubarak presidency in Egypt.  And, in 
20110129023851.000|20110129023854.000|TR0|fact, it's in the U.S. interest for this

20110129023857.000|20110129023900.000|TR0|The Muslim Brotherhood, which had a 
20110129023900.000|20110129023903.000|TR0|political movement decades ago, has not 
20110129023903.000|20110129023906.000|TR0|been very politically active, not been

20110129025218.000|20110129025221.000|TR0|the Internet is, for all intents and 
20110129025221.000|20110129025224.000|TR0|purposes, shut down in Egypt.  That has 
20110129025224.000|20110129025227.000|TR0|angered a lot of Internet users in Egypt.  
20110129025227.000|20110129025230.000|TR0|That has added fuel to the fire.
